children.name: film
children.definition: especially British Englisha story that is told using sound and moving pictures, shown at a cinema or on television: bộ phim
examples: Have you seen any good films recently?
film about
a film about a young dancer
a big-budget filma big-budget film aimed at the mass market

children.name: a horror/adventure/war film
examples: He likes watching horror films.

children.name: a cowboy/gangster etc film
examples: John Wayne was best-known for his roles in cowboy films.

children.name: a feature film
children.definition: a full-length film shown in the cinema
examples: Shane Meadows’ first feature film was 'TwentyFourSeven'.

children.name: a documentary film
examples: He has just completed a documentary film about Thomas Jefferson.

children.name: an independent film
children.definition: a film made by a small film company
examples: Young directors began making small independent films.

children.name: a foreign-language film
children.definition: a film in a language that is not the audience’s native language
examples: Foreign-language films seldom do well at the box office.

children.name: a low-budget film
examples: He’s currently producing his own low-budget film.

children.name: a silent film
children.definition: made in the time before films had sound
examples: a star of silent films

children.name: watch a film
examples: He stayed in and watched a film on TV.

children.name: see a film
examples: We saw a good film last night at the cinema.

children.name: appear in a film
examples: She once appeared in a film with Al Pacino.

children.name: star in a film
children.definition: be one of the main characters in a film
examples: Robert Mitchum starred in a film called 'River of No Return' with Marilyn Monroe.

children.name: direct a film
examples: The film was directed by Jean-Luc Godard.

children.name: edit a film
examples: The film was edited using the latest digital technology.

children.name: make/shoot a film
examples: Sutton has been making a film for Australian television.

children.name: show/screen a film
examples: The film is being shown in cinemas all across the country.

children.name: distribute a film
examples: Warner Bros became the first major studio to distribute its films over the Internet.

children.name: a film stars/features somebody
examples: The film starred Brad Pitt.

children.name: a film is released/comes out
children.definition: it is made available for people to see
examples: The film is due to come out in May.

children.name: a film is showing
children.definition: alsoa film is onBritish English
examples: (= it is being shown at a cinema )The film is on at the Odeon Cinema.

children.name: picture
children.definition: / motion pictureformal a cinema film – used especially by people who make films or by critics :

children.name: a major Hollywood motion picture
examples: Tell us about your latest picture.

children.name: a best picture
examples: It was voted the year’s best picture.
Could this be the first animated movie to win a best picture award?

children.name: The movie took five honours including best picture
movie
children.definition: especially American Englisha film made to be shown at the cinema or on television: bộ phim
examples: It was like one of those old John Wayne movies.
in a movie
She once played the innocent victim in a horror movie.
movie about
a movie about two gay teenagers who fall in love
a movie stars/features somebodya movie starring Will Smith

children.name: an old movie
examples: She was watching an old movie on television.

children.name: a classic movie
children.definition: an old movie that is very good
examples: a scene from the classic movie ‘Casablanca’

children.name: a hit movie
children.definition: a successful movie
examples: He has directed a string of hit movies.

children.name: a cult movie
children.definition: one that a small group of people like very much and watch often
examples: a showing of the cult movie ‘The Rocky Horror Picture Show’

children.name: a big-budget/low-budget movie
children.definition: one that cost a lot of money to make, or very little money to make
examples: He won a role in a big-budget movie.

children.name: watch/see a movie
examples: We watched the movie and ate popcorn.

children.name: go to a movie
examples: How about going to a movie?

children.name: take in a movieAmerican English
children.definition: go to see a movie
examples: Maybe we could go out to dinner and take in a movie.

children.name: appear in/be in a movie
examples: She’s also appeared in ten movies.

children.name: star in a movie
children.definition: play one of the main characters
examples: Depp will star in director Tim Burton’s next movie.

children.name: make/shoot a movie
examples: The children have made their own movies for the contest.

children.name: direct a movie
examples: He wrote and directed the movie.

children.name: show/screen a movie
examples: What movies are they showing this weekend?

children.name: a movie is released
children.definition: becomes available for the public to see
examples: The movie has already been released in the US.

children.name: the movie industry
examples: How did you get started in the movie industry?

children.name: a movie star
examples: She looked like a movie star.

children.name: a movie director
examples: He and his wife are both movie directors.

children.name: a movie producer
examples: He started out as an actor, then became a movie producer.

children.name: a movie premiere
children.definition: the first showing of a movie
examples: She wore the dress to a movie premiere.

children.name: a movie camera
examples: Do you know how to operate a movie camera?

children.name: a movie screen
examples: It was strange to see herself up there on the movie screen.

children.name: film
children.definition: to use a camera to record a story or real events so that they can be shown in the cinema or on television : quay, quay thành phim
examples: The love scenes are sensitively filmed.
She’s in South Africa filming a documentary for the BBC.
Most of the scenes were filmed in a studio.
They filmed for a week in Spain.
this play films well.
a thrillerfilmedentirelyon locationin Washington.

children.name: film
children.definition: the work of making films, considered as an art or a business : phim ảnh
examples: I’m interested in photography and film.
the film industry
a background in film and animation

children.name: the film industry
examples: Scorsese is a highly respected figure in the film industry.

children.name: a film company/studio
children.definition: a company that produces films
examples: a European film company trying to compete with the major Hollywood studios

children.name: a film studio
children.definition: a special building where films are made
examples: Many of the scenes were shot in a film studio.

children.name: a film actor/star
examples: John Voight, the American film star, is perhaps best known for his Oscar winning performance in 'Midnight Cowboy'.

children.name: a film director
examples: This year’s festival includes a tribute to the French film director Bertrand Tavernier.

children.name: a film producer
children.definition: someone who controls the preparation of a film
examples: British film producer Alexander Korda decided to make a movie about Vienna.

children.name: a film maker
children.definition: someone who makes films, especially as a director
examples: He is one of several exciting young film makers.

children.name: a film soundtrack
children.definition: the recorded music for a film
examples: The film’s soundtrack was composed by Ennio Morricone.

children.name: film music
examples: In 'La Strada', Nino Rota demonstrates the poetic power of film music.

children.name: a film festival
examples: The Berlin Film Festival attracted more than 400 films from around the world.

children.name: a film premiere
children.definition: the first showing of a film
examples: Film premieres tend to be glamorous occasions.

children.name: a film crew/unit
children.definition: a group of people working together to make a film
examples: The film crew are making a documentary about village life.

children.name: a film camera
examples: The company produces digital film cameras.

children.name: a film buff
children.definition: someone who is interested in films and knows a lot about them
examples: Film buffs will enjoy reading 'The 100 Best Movies of All Time'.

children.name: a film critic
examples: The review was written by 'The Daily Telegraph’s' film critic.

children.name: a film school
examples: He graduated from film school in 1998.

children.name: film studies
examples: She’s studying for a diploma in film studies.

children.name: silver screen
children.definition: the old-fashionedthe film industry, especially in Hollywood : màn bạc
examples: the stars of the silver screen

children.name: big screen
children.definition: the the cinema, rather than television or the theatre : màn ảnh rộng
examples: He will soon be returning to the big screen for his first movie since 1990.

children.name: on the big screen
examples: She was last seen on the big screen in the comedy ‘Jawbreaker’.

children.name: cinematography
children.definition: specialized the art and methods of film photography : kỹ nghệ điện ảnh, kỹ thuật quay phim
examples: cinematographer[C]

children.name: the cinema
children.definition: mainly UKthe moviesUS  the business of making films: ngành điện ảnh
examples: He was well known for his work in the cinema.

children.name: movies
children.definition: films in general, and the events in them

children.name: in (the) movies
examples: He couldn’t believe his luck. It was the sort of thing that only happened in the movies.

children.name: cinematic
children.definition: specialized relating to the cinema: điện ảnh
examples: The cinematic effects in her films are clearly borrowed from the great film-makers of the past.

children.name: be on/be playing
children.definition: be on/ be playing if a film is on or is playing at a cinema, it is being shown there: đang được chiếu
examples: ‘Three Kings’ is on at the Phoenix at the moment.
Spielberg’s new blockbuster is currently playing at over 2000 theaters nationwide.
what’s on?
What’s on at the cinema this weekend?

children.name: display
children.definition: to show words, pictures, etc. on a screen:
examples: Retailers should display delivery times and costs on their websites.
display a photo
All photos are displayed at a high-resolution so they look perfect on the new iPad's Retina display
